alert.note: Alert for Baxter; Izard; Searcy; Stone (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 2:48AM CDT until August 10 at 5:20AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 520 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL BAXTER, SOUTHERN IZARD, NORTHEASTERN SEARCY AND CENTRAL STONE COUNTIES... At 248 AM CDT, gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past few hours, with the greatest accumulations observed over parts of central Stone county and southern Izard county. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area over the next few hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mountain View, Mount Pleasant, Blanchard Springs Campground, Brandenberg, Herpel, Lone Star, Lunenburg, Gid, Croker, Stella, Maumee, Big Flat, Guion, Allison, Gunner Pool Campground, Fifty-Six, Barkshed Campground, Sylamore Bike Trail, Sylamore Shooting Range and Sylamore. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
